question: This is a complicated question... my mother has brain cancer and has undergone radiation and chemo.  The steroid (decadron) that she needed to take has brought on muscle deterioration as well as diabetes.  She has slowly lost the use of her right hand and has extreme weakness in her right leg.  Her right foot is often swollen.  Frankly her doctors are saying they don't know what it is... "could be the tumor or the chemo.. just dont know".  I wonder if it could be neuropathy or another compication from the diabetes.  When we first learned of her diabetes in June, she could not walk or use the right arm.  That cleared up when the sugar got under control.  However, the insulin does was lowered so much due to low AM readings, that her daytime sugars are kind of high again.  Could these issues be due to the diabetes?  Anyone ever have this?  If so, could it be reversed?
title: Loss of use of right hand and leg.. neropathy?
